oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Merle Haggard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Merle Haggard (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Merle Haggard; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Merle Haggard [unedited] -- (00:42) I Take a Lot of Pride in What I am [featuring Merle Haggard and Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] (Merle Haggard) -- (01:54) Daddy Frank [featuring Merle Haggard and Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] (Merle Haggard) -- (02:50) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (03:17) Old Man From the Mountain Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (03:45) Haggard reveals he had dropped out of school in his youth -- (05:00) Daddy Frank (Merle Haggard) -- (08:04) Phillips provides information about the Bootstrap program closing -- (08:35) Red Cross commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (09:06) Swingin' Doors (Merle Haggard) -- (11:43) Phillips introduces Haggard to reflect on his troubled youth -- (13:38) Mama Tried (Merle Haggard) -- (15:43) Army commercial spot hosted by Tom T. Hall -- (16:32) It's Not Love (But It's Not Bad) (Merle Haggard) -- (19:50) Phillips invites Haggard to reflect on the importance of Fuzzy Owens on his career; additionally, the roots of Haggard are discussed -- (21:39) I'll Break Out Again Tonight (Merle Haggard) -- (24:23) Physical Fitness commercial spot hosted by Lee Sorvino (Unconfirmed) -- (24:53) Everybody's Had the Blues (Merle Haggard) -- (27:29) Phillips introduces Haggard to reflect on outside influences in his music -- (31:16) Take Me Back to Tulsa (Merle Haggard) -- (33:38) Phillips performs a Serviceman's Opportunity College radio spot -- (34:18) Fightin' Side of Me (Merle Haggard) -- (36:57) Phillips and Haggard reflect on whether or not Haggard was looking to perform a film role for Jimmie Rodgers, and Haggard reflects on " I Take a Lot of Pride in What I am" -- (39:26) I Take a Lot of Pride in What I am (Merle Haggard) -- (41:12) Conservation commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (41:45) If We Make it Through December (Merle Haggard) -- (44:15) Phillips asks Haggard about where country music is headed -- (45:49) Okie From Muskogee (Merle Haggard) -- (48:37) commercial spot hosted by pair of unidentified hosts -- (49:39) Early Release Program commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (50:34) Every Fool Has a Rainbow (Merle Haggard) -- (52:53) Phillips asks about Haggards future goals and both say their goodbyes -- (54:46) Unidentified tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] -- (55:53) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (57:55) News feed concerning the formation of the Association of Country Entertainers hosted by Steve Dickert of WKDA.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Haggard, Merle; Haggard, Merle, 1937-2016; Phillips, Rick;
